dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (18:55): arinel: 3DS max has a lot more automation tools than blender does. A *LOT* more. You might say that getting from point A to point B is a lot faster in max than blender. You can do similiar things in blender, it just takes a LOT longer.
5b8f9b3ba8946ecdc32802b9eb4b5cdf (18:56): MickMcMack, ugh...fix the lighting so you dont have the nasty sampling issues cause of the detail
a4009c2895d857e79caebfd744c8a062 (18:56): timmeh, lighting hates me. :X
a4009c2895d857e79caebfd744c8a062 (18:56): But yeah, I'll fix. >_>

dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (18:56): Some might argue that blender has faster modelling toolls, and that may be so, but when it comes to getting a FINISHED PRODUCT, in my experience max has always been much faster than blender at that, namely because of the automation support
041e1433ed7f7fe523ba1cb63cfdd605 (18:57): hi @all. I'm write an exporter. But I don't know how I can open a dialog for asking some options (hmm very brocken english)
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (18:57): oc2k1: You don't.
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (18:57): oc2k1: You can show controls in the script window however.

5b8f9b3ba8946ecdc32802b9eb4b5cdf (18:59): use Draw.PupStringInput if you want something like a popup input

5b8f9b3ba8946ecdc32802b9eb4b5cdf (18:59): there are much better alternatives than scriptUI

5b8f9b3ba8946ecdc32802b9eb4b5cdf (19:01): BeBraw, i dont have links handy for any of them, mine hasnt been released but will be within the next week
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:02): I should probably release the LIBRARY at least.
5b8f9b3ba8946ecdc32802b9eb4b5cdf (19:02): including ui compiler...if thats a sensible name for it
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:02): It's way easy to use.
aac5a080ab55ed52b876625970be765d (19:02): ok. imo blender's py api should contain such a library
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:02): I haven't finished documenting it, but I can give you a GUI test suite that will show you how to use it.
5b8f9b3ba8946ecdc32802b9eb4b5cdf (19:02): BeBraw, no so easy to do...
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:02): BeBraw: I'm doubting that.
aac5a080ab55ed52b876625970be765d (19:04): the ultimate solution would be to build a drag and drop ui editor but that's too easy for the user and too hard for the coder
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:04): My lib isn't terribly hard to use.
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:04): And the great thing about it, the GUI objects are static. They stick around.
5b8f9b3ba8946ecdc32802b9eb4b5cdf (19:04): BeBraw, err that's exactly what one part of my ui compiler does
dbacf1e91861351d2616728069e9baad (19:04): You don't have to reinitialize them on every draw() pass...I set it up so that each object simply has a draw() method through which the draw loop passes.
